text: The 1983 LPGA Championship was the 29th LPGA Championship, played June 9–12 at Jack Nicklaus Golf Center at Kings Island in Mason, Ohio, a suburb northeast of Cincinnati. Seven strokes back after the third round, Patty Sheehan shot a 66 (−6) to win the first of her six major titles, two strokes ahead of runner- up Sandra Haynie, the 54-hole ==Past champions in the field== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- |align=left|Sandra Haynie || align=left| ||1965, 1974 || 70 || 69 || 67 || 75 || 281 || −7 || 2 |- | align=left|Jan Stephenson || align=left| || 1982 || 74 || 67 || 74 || 72 || 287 || −1 || T11 |- |align=left|Nancy Lopez|| align=left| || 1978 || 72 || 75 || 69 || 73 || 289 || +1 || T21 |- |align=left|Donna Caponi || align=left| ||1979, 1981 || 70 || 76 || 75 || 73 || 294 || +6 || T57 |- |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, June 12, 1983 {|class="wikitable" !
